summary: This document is an email correspondence between Jeffrey Epstein and Jes Staley discussing a potential issue in Britain. The email contains a link to a New York Times article and emphasizes the confidentiality of the communication, suggesting it may contain privileged information.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the sender of the email, discussing matters with Jes Staley and emphasizing the confidentiality of the communication.

persons.name: Jes Staley
persons.context: Jes Staley is the recipient of the email, responding to Epstein's previous message and commenting on a situation in Britain.

connections.description: Epstein and Staley are engaged in a personal correspondence discussing current events.

keyFacts: The email correspondence is dated March 28, 2010.
Jeffrey Epstein emphasizes the confidentiality and potential attorney-client privilege of the communication.
Jes Staley mentions flying home from St Barth's in his email.
The email contains a link to a New York Times article regarding a situation in Britain.
There are multiple disclaimers regarding the confidentiality and legal implications of the email.
